free_text.Learning outcomes: [] To make researchers aware of good scientific writing[br/][] To help them structure their articles[br/][] To point out pitfalls in scientific writing[br/][] To enable researchers to face their writing with confidence [br/][] To deal with specific problems in writing research proposals
free_text.Content: Comparing  different styles in scientifc writing[br/]Turning clumsy, wordy writing into clear understandable English[br/]Editing a badly written article[br/]Each participant will write a title, abstract and introduction which will be commented on by all participants and trainer. The emphasis is on structure and readability[br/]The discussion and results section will be dealt in detail with by commenting on  published ones.[br/]On day 4-5 there will be individual sessions of 30 minutes; participants can bring any writing of their own choice. The final part will concentrate on the questions about proposal writing, to avoid common mistakes and increase the effectiveness in convincing referees.[br/]
free_text.Note: maximum 12 participants. Presence at all lectures a requirement.
free_text.Required prior knowledge: as from 2 year and in the process of writing an article
